```{r}
# Load required libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(viridis)

# Set seed for reproducibility
set.seed(42)

# Create sample data for visualization showcase
n <- 50
categories <- c("Design", "Analytics", "Storytelling", "Tools", "Theory")
data <- expand.grid(
  x = seq(0, 10, length.out = n),
  category = categories
) %>%
  mutate(
    y = case_when(
      category == "Design" ~ sin(x) + rnorm(n(), 0, 0.1),
      category == "Analytics" ~ cos(x) + rnorm(n(), 0, 0.1),
      category == "Storytelling" ~ sin(x/2) * cos(x) + rnorm(n(), 0, 0.1),
      category == "Tools" ~ log(x + 1) - 1 + rnorm(n(), 0, 0.1),
      category == "Theory" ~ -0.1 * x + sin(x * 1.5) + rnorm(n(), 0, 0.1)
    ),
    alpha = abs(y)
  )

# Create the visualization
ggplot(data, aes(x = x, y = y, color = category)) +
  geom_line(size = 1.5, alpha = 0.8) +
  geom_point(aes(size = abs(y), alpha = alpha), show.legend = FALSE) +
  scale_color_viridis_d(option = "plasma", end = 0.9) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(0.5, 3)) +
  scale_alpha_continuous(range = c(0.3, 0.9)) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    legend.position = "bottom",
    legend.title = element_blank(),
    axis.text = element_blank(),
    axis.title = element_blank(),
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = NA, color = NA),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = NA, color = NA)
  ) +
  guides(color = guide_legend(nrow = 1))
```
